{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3319298,"name":"Andy C","username":"Andy_C","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T00:06:18.640Z","cooked":"

Hi all! I am running into an issue where the chain will clip the elevator bearings.

Can I add a spacer here to increase the chain distance from the tubestock?

(I am thinking of 3D printing it out of PETG)

Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-02-28T00:06:18.640Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":67.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":456435,"topic_slug":"can-i-do-this-with-the-thriftybot-elevator-kit","display_username":"Andy C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55390,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-i-do-this-with-the-thriftybot-elevator-kit/456435/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3319304,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-28T00:21:22.685Z","cooked":"

Should be able to offset it a fair bit.

Finoff season bots we have attached chain and offset it just by using a 1" hex spacer and a long faster/washer.

Would it still be fine if I’m climbing with the elevator?

Would you happen to have a picture of your setup?

I think the more support you can provide the chain the better, so the 3d printed option with dense infill and a large footprint would probably be best.

I can try to snag a photo.
